name: The Crown Hotel Napier

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for one night only as part of a self-drive tour of the North Island. The best hotel we stayed at, the room was spacious and extremely comfortable and the service on check in/out and porterage couldn't be faulted. A little way out of Napier but no bad thing. Ask for a room overlooking the ocean and try the adjoining cafe owned by the hotel - excellent breakfasts.
reviews.title: Would certainly return

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed one night. Excellent service at check in - shown to our room. Room was spacious and well equipped, although shower only, no bath. We had a room with view over the water and a balcony. This made all the difference, and I think a different room with only a view over the street would not have been as pleasant.
reviews.title: Hard to fault

reviews.text: Good location with restaurants and cafes adjacent, and quite good value with a last minute internet deal. Recommended.
reviews.title: Great hotel for couples, not so good with young child in tow

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here a couple of years ago pre children and loved it - then we had a studio room with a view of the sea and the room felt like we were the first ever people to use it.
reviews.title: Great place to stay

reviews.text: This time, we took our two year old son and had a one bedroom suite on the side of the building. More rooms have been added since we were there last time and a restaurant - Milk and Honey - has opened.
reviews.title: A great find

reviews.text: It pains me to rate a hotel lower than I would like to, unfortunately this hotel did not meet my expectations at the price point. I booked a premium 2 bedroom suite, price range is $440-$660 per night, a rate that did not include breakfast. As far as I could tell this differs from the standard suite, in that the standard has 1 less en-suite, no wash machine/dryer and perhaps a little smaller. The hotel was air-conditioned (quiet) in the main hall (not ducted to the bedrooms). The hotel has only 2 of these rooms situated at the top floor and facing the sea. The larger room with ensuite comes with bathroom (nearly as large as the bedroom) and a bath/spa combination. The other room has an ensuite with a shower. Both equipped with the usual towels, amenities (shampoo, conditioner, soap) and thick bathrobes. Also has fully equipped kitchen with mini bar. It was kept very clean and the hotel is very new. The first thing that struck me was how tiny the LCD TV was (only about 20"), perhaps having rented an apartment at Taupo the night before for about the same price with a 42" LCD TV made it seem smaller.
reviews.title: Noise from construction next door may be useful if you forget to set the alarm

likes.disliked: — Construction & demolition noise from next door. Sad looking gym.

reviews.text: The rooms are reasonably well insulated from road noise which is between the hotel and the sea. However this peace was broken in the morning when construction/demolition began next door. I asked if another room was available but they said only the standard rooms were available (with no mention of any refunds). I booked directly from the hotel website which promised free wine or something. I did not get this nor did I bother to ask for any. The website displays pictures from 3 sides but not the side where all the construction is happening, nor did it mention anything about the possibility that your stay may be less than peaceful. I will leave it up to you as to what you think of this omission. In the past, my stay at quality resorts were heavily discounted if the presence of construction would even remotely affect the tranquility. Attached are pictures showing the construction side which they have left out.
reviews.title: Very modern

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There are undercover parks available but they are not enough for all the rooms and are not allocated either. So don't expect any premium rates you pay to guarantee a covered park, as they are on a first come first served basis.
reviews.title: Really enjoyed the art deco heritage suite

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only downfall was that it was a bit out of town; however the rooms were brand new & very modern, we booked an ocean view room at the last minute which was good value, and the restaurant downstairs was lovely.
reviews.title: Great room / fantastic view

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for 1 night in mid January and we thought it was a lovely modern hotel. Plenty of parking which was included in the rate. We got a great deal for a suite with a sea view on the first floor on the new part of the hotel, especially with the strong euro rate against the NZ dollar. We were told that our room was only 64 days old. This hotel is in a suburb area along the sea approx 5 minutes drive from city centre in Napier. However we were glad to have not stayed inside in Napier. There are numerous restaurants in this area. We ate in caution/shed 1 restaurant based on reviews of others on trip advisor. However we were very disappointed with the service and standard of food available in this restaurant. We would rate this one of our poorest meals and one of the worst for value for money while we stayed in NZ. We were also told that caution restaurant was booked out but we counted at least 15 tables that were free during the night - we got the impression that if you didnt have a reservation you were pushed into the shed 1 adjacent restaurant. The hotel had a great breakfast and the staff were excellent - we would rate the continental breakfast as one of the best we had in NZ and fantastic value for money - 15NZ dollars or 6 euro for each !! Overall we would strongly recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel with great seaside location

likes.disliked: — Some noise from hotel bar and the local road outside but nothing too serious

reviews.text: I have been lucky enough to travel around New Zealand with work. I booked this hotel against the advice of a colleague, am I glad I did.
reviews.title: What a find!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.title: All a bit average

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.title: Well appointed room, but a bit pricey.

reviews.text: The Crown hotel is located a little way out of Napier, but for us it was perfect. Napier itself is very busy and touristy so staying at the Crown while on business was ideal. It is a few kilometres out of town in a very nice area with great cafes and restaurants. Milk and Honey, the hotel's cafe overlooks the ocean. Our room was spacious, modern and spotless, I could not fault it at all. The view from the balcony was fantastic, straight onto the ocean. I know some previous reports have mentioned the grotty little cafe opposite the crown thats constantly pumps out horrible greasy chicken smells, (should be shut down or moved to an industrial area!) but for us this was not a problem, the wind seemed to be blowing the other way.This will always be our pick of hotel in Napier as many of the other establishments appear a little tired and past their use by day. We ate at the Resurant on a few occassions, also good although menu was a little limited.I highly recommend The Crown Hotel.
reviews.title: Great Hotel overlooking the ocean.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were allocated a corner room on the top (4th) floor of the new wing and we were not disappointed.
reviews.title: Lovely & modern hotel

reviews.text: The room was immaculately clean and everything was modern and brand new - just how I like it! Nice, tasteful furniture, large comfy bed with amazing soft white linen on it...and a fabulous bathroom with spa bath and oversized walk in shower. How a previous reviewer could possibly say that the finish felt cheap I don't know! In reality it is the opposite - the furnishings are of very good quality and are stylish. The good sized balcony offered a panoramic view of the sea directly across the road and the sunlight streaming into the room made everything feel light and airy. The sink, fridge and tea/coffee were impressively concealed behind a folding wooden door that when closed looked like a wardrobe.
reviews.title: Great view in a quiet location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My only gripe was that the open wardrobe - although neatly tucked round the corner out of view - had one rod that wasn't tall enough for me to hang the knee-length dress I had brought with me for the wedding I was attending. Also, the hangers were the type that you can't remove from the wardrobe, so it wasn't as though I was able to just hang the dress from, say, the bathroom door on a hanger. In the end I had to improvise and hang the dress by its straps off the wall mounted plasma TV!
reviews.title: Bland at best

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All in all though, this is a great hotel and I would definitely stay again. Ahuriri, where this hotel is located, is a lovely spot with a handful of funky restaurants and bars lined along the dock at nearby West Quay.
reviews.title: Smart hotel with a few drawbacks

description: Set in the picturesque seaside village of Ahuriri. The Crown Hotel Napier is only 5 minutes to Napier and a short drive to the award winning vineyards of the Hawkes Bay. The hotel offers 39 contemporary guestrooms and suites with an additional 3 new luxury executive apartments. Choose from the elegant heritage suites in the original 1932 Crown Hotel building or the contemporary designed rooms overlooking the ocean. The Crown Hotel offers the ultimate combination of classic opulence and history to modern luxury and design. Offering full conference facilities, complimentary carparking, access to fitness centre, 2 bars and an award winning restaurant Milk & Honey…relax and indulge at a boutique hotel with timeless charm and genuine personalised service.
